meanings.definition: To eat a large amount of food quickly and greedily.
meanings.sent1: The hungry bear gorged on the berries in the forest.
meanings.sent2: After the long hike, they gorged on pizza and soda.
meanings.sent3: The kids gorged on candy at the birthday party, feeling like little kings and queens.
meanings.sent4: She gorged on knowledge, devouring books like a hungry lion.
meanings.sent5: The buffet table was gorged with delicious treats, tempting everyone to overindulge.

meanings.definition: To fill oneself with food to the point of discomfort.
meanings.sent1: He gorged on popcorn at the movies until he felt sick.
meanings.sent2: The feast was so grand that they gorged themselves until they could barely move.
meanings.sent3: The cat gorged on tuna until its belly bulged comically.
meanings.sent4: The greedy squirrel gorged on nuts, hoarding them for later.
meanings.sent5: The dragon gorged on gold, its treasure trove overflowing with riches.

meanings.sent1: The fire gorged on the dry wood, spreading rapidly through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The storm clouds gorged on moisture, ready to unleash a downpour.
meanings.sent3: The vacuum cleaner gorged on dust bunnies, cleaning the room in no time.
meanings.sent4: The black hole gorged on stars, swallowing them whole in the vast universe.
meanings.sent5: The river gorged on rainfall, swelling its banks with water.
